content: On August 1, 1982, the Atlanta Braves made a significant move by trading for future Hall of Famer and legendary pitcher, Tommy John. This trade, which involved sending infielder and future All-Star, Bob Horner, to the New York Yankees, was part of a larger strategy to bolster the Braves' pitching staff as they aimed for postseason success. Although John would only pitch for the Braves for a short time before retiring, this moment marked a pivotal shift in the franchiseâ€™s approach during their successful run in the early 1980s.
